intro: Houstonia latifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. It has opposite, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Houstonia latifolia is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to thrive in partial to full shade.
